content: Hey crafters DM Scotty here going to have it me
now a lot of you who have followed me already realized the benefits of 2.5 D
just the playability the ease of construction and so forth and so on but
there are other advantages too today we're going to show you a passage that
the players will have to squeeze through and if you did this in a 3d terrain and
made the passage so teeny but the actual model wouldn't fit through that would be
very problematic but in 2.5 D is super easy so let's go to the table I'll show
you how I did that I show you my stuff with DM Scotty here we are our trusty
adventurers come in and they come down the hall and they unfortunately come to
a blocked passage the hall is totally blocked with rubble so the Rope checks
it out and she notices a very small passage that clear a very small passage
through they start digging a bit and here's what they see so here's the tile
and you see it's really choked and skinnier than the mini up to the point
where it turns into a normal 2.5 D Hall and so you could have her you know
moving through you could have it make checks every so every you know certain
point you have them make squeeze checks or athletics checks to get through you
get up monsters come and fight them so you know kind of neat so then you could
have the other people and to try to squirm through there and there you go
and if you need to lay them on there it's easy enough because it's 2.5 D so
no worries there you go a squeezing passage so I thought some of you might
like to see how I did this tiled very easy I just did the standard 2.5 D tile
and I I cut the walls irregularly and made it so that they would join together
and make a very small passage through that tile and here on the completed tie
you can see I added those walls on the side so it makes a skinny passage
through that tile and opens up into a normal tile like a
normal 2.5 detail now I used hot glue on that and what I did what also what I did
was I put construction sand on it till the way have looked like rubble and then
we had our finished tile eight crafters was great to have you with me if you're
interested in 2.5 D technique make sure you check out my other vids also we have
a Facebook group and a forum that tons of crafters on there willing to share
all their techniques and crafts we'd love to have you and last but not least
go forth and craft
